page.title: 15Local Publications.
page.content: {The Avon Advertiser}has been in existence for six years. In the beginning only 3 people were employed. There are now over 30 employees. The type-setting of this local publication is done by an allied company based also in Fordingbridge -{Ford Graphics. The earliest Advertiser had only 4 pages and 3000 copies were delivered. Today there is a circulation of over 100000 copies, each with 44 pages. It is a free weekly publication. {The Gate}is a local magazine containing local news, reports on club activities and forthcoming events. It arose from an idea by a local priest who started a small newsletter called {The Rockbourne Record.}From this developed The Gate round about 1967. This duplicated magazine is delivered monthly to houses in Fordingbridge and the surrounding villages.It costs 10p.
